transcript.content: Well, I know that must be some people’s favourite record, Steve.
I don't want a bad word said against the Boss.
People dismissed him in the past as some kind of stadium rocker, but if you can't listen to a song like that and not be moved, surely, Karl?
It's certain songs I like, that was--that was alright. It wasn't anything--
If it wasn't Bruce Springsteen, if someone new came out sounding like that, I'd go “Yes, it's alright”.
You're a regular Simon Cowell, aren't you?
I--I don't know if I like music as much as I used to now. That's what happens when you work in it. There was-Dani Minogue's on telly in the week-
Is it like when you work in a sweet factory, and you don't--don't nick the Mars bars after a couple of months?
Dani Minogue was in the telly in the week, right?
and, she was doing, doing a medley.
Well, to try and get in all the hits. I know-I know what you mean, yeah.
But who is so busy that they haven't got time to listen to the full album, or--
It's like a Meal in pill form.
Well, I like most of Dani Minogue's hits, but I don't like the whole song.
So if you would just pop the best bits down, 30 seconds, put ‘em all together..
I've got um, a ‘Stars on forty-five’ record, from the seventies. Do you remember those?

(singing) Stars on forty-five! But it started, like you say, I mean, this one had a kind of....it would be a snatch of Stevie Wonder, followed by the M.A.S.H. theme, followed by Leyla, just the intro. It was sort of, it's not music
Yeah, yeah, yeah. Well, we do a bit of that, don't we? Is what DJ-ing is, isn't it? It's a bit of everything. But we play the whole song, don't we often?
We're better, aren't we, Karl? So what do you want to talk about today?
Uh---d’ya wanna look at the list?
Well, it's got “describe looks”. It's our list we've brought. This is our very amusing, sort of, link, of describing your look
No, I was just thinking like, you know, everyone's got an idea in their head?
Careful, Karl. Don't open yourself up to criticism. Go on, yeah.
D'ya know what I mean, everyone's got an idea of-what they look like an' stuff. Uhm-if someone wanted to know what I look like, or what Ricky look like, or what you look like, Steve, if that..
Uhm-what would you use to describe yourself? D'ya know what I mean?
Not really, I don't understand. What would-

Someone who doesn't know us, we've gotta describe, and we’ve...what's the game, to hopefully get some, sort of, interpersonal language going? So, you know they've got the same image as you, to a certain extent?
Well, I was thinking if I was to meet Steve in a restaurant.
Nothing untoward going on, we're just hanging out.
No, just having a chat. Just having a normal night out and that.
Who's paying? Cause I mean, is it expensive?
Go Dutch. Go Dutch. I mean-
Right. So, I say to you “I'll see you at eight, right, in this, in this restaurant”.
I turn up at the door, it's a bit of a posh place.
Uhm. I say , “is Steve Merchant in?”
And the waiter sort of goes: (with accent) I don't know, what's he look like, right?
And, eh (without accent): What's he look like?. The thing I pick up on first: “He's tall. Tall lad.”
And then he goes (with accent): oh,you know, we got loads of tall people in, alright?
And then he'd go: “Yeah, he's over there”.
I'll be honest with you. I mean, you can have dinner, you can buy me dinner, but I'm not sure you're getting anywhere with me. You're slagging me off.
No, no! I'm not slagging you off, though. That's what I'm saying.
Just using-using what comes to mind.
..can I assume that they know, like, could I say, like, the easiest for me? I'd say, uhm, looks like Reg Varney from On the buses. Would they understand that, could I use, sort of, like, references?
Yeah, he’s thirty-odd this waiter, so he'll-
So,(with accent) Yes, Reg Varney is zitting over there, yeah. Went to German towards the end.
Huh! I'd describe you more, I think, as, I would imagine, I'd say—“have you ever seen that Johnny Vegas on the telly?”
Imagine he was inflatable, and you just let out a bit of air...
As opposed to like, you know, pumping harder.

Uhm, Okay. Uhm, what describes—Karl, I'd describe as, you know those little red monkeys that you see on wildlife programmes? They're little, in the trees and scream when they see a leopard or something?
Shave that. Just shave one of those little red monkeys. And put some, sort of, uhm, you know, old sort of Manchester gear on it, maybe.
An anorak and some baggy jeans...
I'd like to see how the waiter’d react to that!
He's got a picture of a monkey. Then he's got a picture of it shaved--got no hair, dressed like some kind of Manc scally.
Then goes: He's over there. Yeah, he's over there, Karl's over there. That's what I'd do.
So, uhm, now coming up: The Verve. After that: An amusing link about gay handkerchiefs!
Huh, really? Looking forward to this.
Lucky Man by The Verve on XFM 104.9. I'm Ricky Gervais. With me Steve Merchant and Karl Pilkington. Karl? What's the problem with gay hankies?
(long pause) You were-- we played Bruce Springsteen last week, right?
And you said he'd got a--uhm-- lot of trouble on his hands. He had-uhm-had a hanky in his back pocket.
Did i say that on air, or-
There is a saying that famously on the cover of Born to run-uhm-Born in the USA album, it's just him, isn't it, with a--uhm--his backside and a red handkerchief-
(slight laugh) I did it for research purposes--
He,he.So, he had a red handkerchief, I think in his right back pocket. Apparently that signifies homosexuality, apparently, I don't know.
Ah,  I thought it was which way you...take--I don't know, though. Those myths, I--
I don't even know, I dunno if there's--
No, I read up about it.
--and it's all sorta, you know, it's all different coloured hankies.
Yeah. Right, it depends what pocket you put it in--
--as well, you got different colours, different pockets
Sorry, how many variations are there, different pockets are what? What's it --
Your back pocket, your right back pocket--
Well, what do they signify? You can't just tell us they signify summit. What do they signify?
Well, some stuff we don't really wanna talk about, to be honest
Wha-- stuff that gays are into.
No, like...a couple of things that were there I know we can mention. It said something about-
I love that he thinks he can't mention-
Do you see? What is this? 1956?
No, no. But I mean, it isn't just having it away, sorta-
(exclaiming laughingly )Why I love him! 'aving it away!
They get up to some weird stuff
I love the fact that he didn't wanna offend, but he's offended a lot more people--
--get up to some weird stuff. Right!
Yeah! What d'ya mean. No--but--don't--don't--if--i-it's research about summit I don't know about--it's like you can't say on the radio--
But what d'ya mean, weird stuff?
Well, one of them, right? If you got a red 'anky, right?
Like Bruce. That's exactly what Bruce had.
Well, apparently then is an armpit freak.
Wo--Wha--Okay.Right,okay. What else it there then?

Sorry, is there some kind of homosexual body that sat down and came up with this at some point. Well, so we got, this is getting crazy, we got, like, a blue handkerchief in your top breast pocket, I don't know what that means. You need to sit down at so kind of summit, figure out what it means.
I-it just that, you might not be free from it either, so if you were to got into, like, a--a gay bar--
--which you know, you might to if you're straight anyway, cause they're, you know, good places, I think?
Uhm--You can't actually go in there if you've got a cold, because every coloured hanky represents something.
So if I was to go in, had a bit of a sniffle, I could get into all sorts of trouble.
What? Mark's and Spencer's white linen hanky, that means--you like to be tied up and whipped.
Yeah. There was another one--uhm--armpit freak we've covered
Armpit freak! I don't even know what that means!
There's just another thing, a blue and white one is if you're into sailors.
Yeah. If you have a little blue and white hanky that's in your left pocket--
--uhm--blue and white equals sailor. That's ho-
I wanted to ask you something. You know--and we gotta be careful here--you know when you wouldn't leave the building that was on fire, because --uhm--uh--you...were--you were standing proud.
Hang on.We need-- some people don't know what you're talking about.You--Karl, you're on holiday--
You've had a moment of intimacy with your girlfriend.
A knock on the door, you had to stop and get up. You peeked around the door, it was a fireman saying: Get out! But you didn't want to leave, because you 'ad a-- yeah?
It was a little--Yeah?--but. Why--I--what I don't understand is you maintained that while looking at a Spanish man dressed as a fireman.
Is that true? Is that the fact? You maintained--I'm sorry to say--you maintained a--uhm--you know--arousal whilst looking at a gentleman dressed as a fireman?
(intensely)Is that--these are the facts, they aren't disputed.What-
But I'm not a machine, though. D'ya what I mean.(snapping fingers) I can't turn it on, turn it off.Right?
I-I-I was just thought you--talking to a fireman, you'd have probably lost it, I dunno, but tou didn't
--was, I mean, I was talking to Suzanne about it again,right?
She was: What are you talking about that for?, right?
And the dilemma was I wanted to make sure, cause that was the last proper condom we had, right?
So it would have ruined the night, right?
So I was--I didn't wanna like--it was like: What's going on?
Is it .. do we need to get out?
--to this man in uniform, what did he look like. Was he quiet--was he good looking?
Did he look like Ricky Martin?
Was he good looking? Was he good looking in his uniform.
Play a record, don't we? Is this bringing it back?
Did you just...switch on the song with your hands?
Song - The Flaming Lips - The Fight Test
The Flaming Lips and That's Fight Test.

We were talking there about homosexual people, I'm sure we'll move on to other topics, uhm, but I just mentioned...I was just talking to a friend of mine in the week, uh, Rufus, and he overheard, uh, he pieced together, you know sometimes when you hear a conversation you can piece together what's going on?

and, em, it sort of transpired from what he could make out that one gay guy had just realised, or just found out that his gay boyfriend had, uhm, maybe had been having an affair, and was on the phone, uhm, and had called this person, the third party-
The other one was crying, wasn’t he?

The other one was crying; in tears. Obviously they'd just had a big argument about it. And all he heard on the phone was- was the guy saying in very kinda earnest tones: “I'm gonna do everything in my power to destroy you!”
I'd just like to see what that was. What was--
No more guest lists to G.A.Y.
Yeah, I am going to, uhm, slash your diesel jeans....with a pair of scissors (starts laughing).
I know, I mean, it's probably an emotionally time for them.
Yeah, they probably don't think we're talking about them.
It's probably happened quite a lot this week.
I--I do know quite a lot, uhm, gay people, right?
But they do, uhm, they do jump about when it comes to partners.
Don't, leave, leave! Freedom of speech.
No! I'm not saying that's a bad thing, I mean it's quite, you know, they don't, you know if they get bored, they move on, and that-
How have you pieced this together?
And they go out late, don't they?
Oh, we've covered that, haven't we? We've done that.
How have you, so, your, you-
D'ya know how we've covered that? His favourite record is Killing of Georgie, and he went at the end of the record, he went: See, but 'ow late was it?
”If he'd had been sorta gone out at a decent time (chuckling) that wouldn't have happened, or”-
D'ya know what I mean, Steve?
They're always getting ready to go out at half past one in the morning.
Is there, I should just point out that, uhm--

--we've had an email, I've lost it here now. But anyway it was one of our listeners saying we've slightly embarrassed ourselves because, of course, Bruce Springsteen on the cover of 'Born in the USA' doesn't actually have a handkerchief in his back pocket, it's actually a red baseball cap.
So, uhm, I don't know if that also counts-

(Chuckling) Yeah. Into 'eads. Into little round 'eads. Awww. If Bruce Springsteen - and he's obviously not gay - but if he said: “Alright, Karl, uhm, just, you know, little cuddle”, would you turn down Bruce Springsteen?
Well, no! But why? Just let, alright, mate, you hug your mates, don't you? If Bruce said: “Alright, Karl? I like your show, love your head, a little cuddle--a little cuddle. A mates’ cuddle.”
No. I--I just: “What are you doing?!
”Look, we're a couple of old friends”--
--Bruce Springsteen, all his great songs. “I like what you're doing, let's cuddle, let's have a little--alright,mate?”
The annoying thing is, right, Steve, right? D'ya know have he likes to squeeze me head?
How Ricky likes to squeeze me head?
-he had a, an old mate over this week. He's got a similarly shaped head, apparently, as mine.
--right? He 'ardly gave me a call or anything. He was busy with this other fella's head.
Aww, you feel bad, quite bad about that?
His is a better head to squeeze, I'll tell you why. Cause he shaves it every day, right? He's got the same sorta hair problem as you--shaves it every day, right?

No, I know. And because he has it shaved all the time--Karl's sorta comes through a bit long at the sides sometimes, looks a bit unkempt towards the end of the week. I've seen—there’s a, there's a couple of little pimples under there.
I've really have to do it, just like, get there, slap my hands there, squeeze it. With this one I can sorta get my fing--d'ya know what I mean, I can get my, um, really, you know.
You're like a gay the way you jump about from head to head.
(laughing) Play a record! “You’re like a gay”.
Just sayin'. Still coming up then.
Oh, any Monkey News this week?
It's not much that's been going on this week.
In the monkey world, I don't know if they've caught on the fact that they're getting coverage.
Been a bit careful, what, I've found something--
Have you got Rockbusters? It's your last chance, don't forget. Is it good, these?
Got Rockbusters. Got good prizes, Steve, we'll look at them in a bit.
We've got Cheeky freak of the Week?
Yeah. So what deformity is it that you're, that we're--
Rolling Stones - Waiting on a friend
I didn't really appreciated The Stones when I was younger, I was always a Beatles fan, but now I can't really listen to the Beatles..
It's about five tracks I like.
Yea, but The Stones just get better and better
And now it's brilliant. The video's so good
Ah, amazing. 1981.That was 'Waiting on a friend’. With the Rolling Stones.
What we got?We got more fun coming up, I imagine
Yeah. Cheeky Freak of the Week: An amusing story about inflatable testicles
We've already given you half an hour talking about gay people. Who knows what else will be coming up.
Out of time by Blur. On XFM 104.9. Alright, Karl? What are you thinking?
I would just say hello...we've got an American listener, apparently. Karen...anyway, what else have we got?
Think that'll might fill up four seconds
We're not struggling, are we? I mean..
No, no! We’ll, just consult the list of Dr. Fox-esque amusing topics.
Wife, wet ones, screwball, shop train, cheeky freak, Ronan. What's that?
Ronan. I just was, uh, telling you the other day about, you know, that song that he does. Uh (singing)'”Loving every day as if it's your last....one”
I was just thinking was, he’s saying that as if, like; oh, have a good day? But I reckon if he knew it was your last day I don't think you'd been in the mood to do anything

...that's true. I think the point is live everyday like it's your last. So Karl, imagine if it was every like your last: Let's go mental. And the good thing is: We got tomorrow. So he's got the best of both worlds. That's what Ronan's saying. He's saying: Cram it in, cos it might be the last. I think it's more like...It's the not knowing. Live every day...see? I'd actually be happy, if, if I never knew..( Karl interrupts)) when I was gonna die.
..and I was definitely die in my sleep. What a brilliant life you'd have. D'ya know what I mean?
What, so you don't get any illness, but one night you go to bed..?
I know that if you know you were gonna die in your sleep, and never knew when you were gonna die it wouldn’t matter if it's tomorrow or thirty years time. It wouldn't matter, would it?

I've lost you, haven't I? I've lost you somewhere. I can't, I can't work out, see, I thought it was pretty easy all that.I said: “Die in your sleep, and not know when you died”. There was no high concepts there. No sleight of hand linguistically. Where did I lose you?
I think you lost him on sleight of hand linguistically
I think that's the way I’d, I’d wanna go...I don't wanna know about it. That's why I don't go the doctor's or anything
Brilliant. And he, he, he’d, do you remember him saying: He's gonna die of cancer, cause he doesn't check his balls, he doesn't like the feel.
What do they feel like, your balls?
With two marbles..two kumquats in a chamois leather
No, they're not. I'm just saying smooth
In case a fireman pops round when you're undressed; it looks like your head. Fireman pops around, there you are, and he goes: “Oh, nice smooth”--
So you never go to the doctor's? What even--
Even if you found some bubos under your arm or something?
I'd wait for a bit and I'd say to Suzanne: “What do you think?”
To see if it develops into plague
Well, yeah. Cause you know, don't you
Old bandages around your head, and a bell. “Suzanne, can you get me a bell?”

There was this kid at our school, we took the piss out of for the, basically, rest of his time there. It was when we were about eleven, someone said: How would you wanna die, right...drowning, fire all that. He said “I wanna die of old age in my mother's arms”.
In my mother's arms? What, getting off with her?
No, die of old age, how old was she? Brilliant, I wanna die of old age with my nan and my mum
Yeah, all in the same bed
So, if you, if, if it was the last day, you've got one day to live. What would you do with your day? Now, let's assume that, uhm, you're not in a state of ill health
There's not that much you can do, though
It's just the end of the world, and you've--
--what do you mean it's not much you could do? That's what we're asking you
It's the last day in your life

It depends, doesn't it? If we're all in the same boat, if someone says: “Oh, unlucky”, uh-without bitterness, “we've accidentally exposed you to some radiation poisoning and you've got a day”. Or, if it was like, “there’s meteor coming this way, we're all in the same boat”, I think it would be different. It depends whether it's you and the rest of the world. No?
I'd do the same thing. I'd steal a car and go joy-riding. But like go mental, I’d be smashing stuff, I'd be knocking people over for a laugh. I'd be going crazy, it'd be like Grand Theft Auto.
It'd be extraordinary. Driving through a park
That’s what I did in The Getaway. I'm trying to play it seriously and within about ten minutes I was just going round areas that I knew to knock people over.
Yeah...I-I don't think I would do that much. Seriously. You couldn't watch telly, cause you might not know how the thing ends.
Sure. Yeah. Be a waste of time
You could watch 24, couldn't you? The whole day.
Wha- But let's be honest. Let's say, you know, you could take all your money out of your bank account. You could fly anywhere in the world, you could do whatever you want.
Well, not a long flight. You couldn't..
Well, no, But you’ve got your girlfriend.
Australia, you wouldn't make it, would you?
Why do you- what- why wouldn't you go to the monkey sanctuary down in Cornwall, and just roam round cuddling as many monkeys as you can?
I'm gonna tell you something now
Taking me mum and dad away. ‘Cause like Suzanne's mum and dad..
Most people put them in a home. Well, it's, how - monkey sanctuary is cheaper?
Taking them down, yeah, taking them down to Cornwall.
Hold on. I thought you said you'd never go away with parents again?
No, no. That was Suzanne's mum and dad.
Oh, is this to get even, or something?
So, yeah. So we'll do that, and then we'll can it, then
"That was your outing". Your phoning your both sets of parents, and you go, right: "You won't be seeing us ever again on holiday. We're taking you away, we're taking you away."
Be careful that the monkey people don't buy you off your parents.
Yeah. Make sure, make sure they don't leave any of the monkeys' food in a telephone box, cause your dad will have that away.
Oh. I was talking to them about that the other day. About the, eh, nicking in phone boxes. And he-

They live in a small village in Wales. And, uh, it's like one, sort of, utility store, and when it's shut they leave your shopping in the telephone box across the road. And Karl's dad found out about this, and goes and helps himself.

And, uh, I was talking to him about that. Saying, you know: “Have you picked up any surprises, you found in the box?” And, he said “no”. We're talking about other stuff he used to do. One of them used to be going to this supermarket, right, in Manchester-
Needs a new pair of shoes.
Go in, take a new pair off the shelf, pop them on, leave his old ones there
Unless you go in after him and buy his old ones back, like an idiot
Yeah. You go in the next day. “Hey, they look nice. My mates got a pair just like them. I've always wanted some.”
Incidentally, we don't advocate the stealing of shoes from shops.
Or, or, or, the joy-riding and killing people.
Unless you got one day left
Elton John - Saturday Night's Alright (for Fighting)
Elton John - Saturday Night's Alright (for Fighting)
Ah, brilliant. Is there a jingle for Rockbusters? I don't think there is one, is there?
Could you come up with one quickly?
The prizes this week, there's not many. I have to say Karl's not sourced many, but what he has got are actually good quality.
Well, I've been trying to instil in him it's--you know--quality, not quantity.
As opposed to what--like, 15 copies of, you know, Fools and Horses Christmas Special with a giveaway three wheeler--
--car, and Primal Scream's greatest hits on 11 CD's.
Yeah. Not Primal Scream. Inspiral Carpets.
Yes, I thought, that was it. Yeah, yeah.

Inspiral Carpets. Yeah, we've got, uhm, this new KISS FM hip hop classics compilation which's got some really good stuff on there. Eh, new stuff from the likes of, uhm, you know, Outkast and the Wu Tang, but some old classics from Public Enemy, of course, LL Cool J's 'Mama said knock you out'. It's worth having alone for that track.
Uhm-I think this is four CDs, no, it's two CDs. The best Air Guitar Album in the World Volumes 1 and 2 in a special box set--
But also excellent stuff: Beastie Boys, The Clash, we've got the Kinks, so that's good. Abigail's Party the DVD from Alison Steadman, I know you're quite a fan of that, aren’t you, Rick?
She's a, from many years ago, if you’ve not seen it's uhm, it's good. This Later with Jools Holland DVD, it's got live performance by PJ Harvey, The Cardigans, Rollins--
But is he playing boogie-woogie over their tracks.
Also, it's the new album from The Thrills?
Uhm, yeah, the new album. Yeah
a little exclusive, it's not even out yet, is it?
Well..it's not the sorta thing Karl can come up with, if pushed.
(from the other side of the room) So don’t start...
It's all about the game, though. All about the game, the prizes are for fun-
It's all about the playing of the game.
Let's see what Karl's come up with this week. This is his last chance. If I ever hear anything like New Odour again-
They did get it, though, didn't they?
Right, if you haven't heard it before, cryptic clues, uhm, that make up a band, and some initials to help you on your way, as well.
Well, you'd never get it without, but go on.
First one, uhm: That fella likes suckin' on iron. Alright?
That fella likes sucking on iron?
Yeah. The initial there: M. Alright?
That fella likes suckin' on iron. Right, that's the first one. Second one, uhm: The Jamaican fella spots a boat.
The Jamaican fella spots a boat.
The Jamaican fella (distinctly) spots a boat.
And the last one, uhm: D'ya want a game of tug of war? Well, it's up to you, you own it. Alright.
I- I just got number two, oh God..
D'ya want a game of tug of war? Well, it's up to you, you- you own it.

Right. The first one: That fella likes suckin' on iron, it's M. Second one: Jamaican fella spots a boat. Right? That's D. And the last one: D'ya want a game of tug of war? Well, it's up to you, you know, it's- you own it. Right.
(sniggering) I love the way he embellishes it like it's a full story at the end.
Ricky dot Gervais at xfm dot co dot uk.
Email only. We cannot be bothered to answer the phone. Ricky dot Gervais at xfm dot co dot uk.
The White Stripes - I Just Don't Know What To Do With Myself
Red Hot Chili Peppers - Universally Speaking
Red Hot Chili Peppers - Universally Speaking on XFM 104.9. Well, halfway through, Steve. I'm Ricky Gervais, that was Mr. Merchant I was referring to there, as Steve-
Familiar, friends by now. Five years in the making. Karl Pilkington: I've only known him a year and a half, but he's a good friend as well.
So? Any interesting things to talk about, guys? Dr Fox style.
-any amusing observations? Have you taken a sideways look on this week's news or anything, Karl, what have you?
I'll tell you what I did hear last night
Uhm- Five Live. They do like a review of what's gone on in the week. I'm always busy in the week, I haven't got time to, to follow what's gone on.
Uhm, someone's made a chicken with teeth
-they had a- had a few guests saying: “well, you know, where will it all end?”
So, you're sure you weren't watching a Wallace and Gromit video?
No, seriously, right? It’s, uhm, doing it.
Why would they spend millions researchi--
What do you mean "there's a chicken with teeth"? What the f--. What do you mean "there's a chicken with teeth"?
What are you talking about, Karl?
That's what they've done, d'ya know like--

I dunno. It’s just messin' with science and that. And that's what the people were saying, like, “why are you doing that, d'ya know what I mean, where will it stop? What's the next thing.? They did the sheep. They did the cloning.”
The rat with an ear on its back.
Can hear a mouse, a cat coming, can't it?
(softly) Ehm, what else did were they talking about? They talked about that sheep again. That cloning one.
Cause they do all look the same anyway.
What's it got to do with its cleverness-?
Being cloned. Is, is it, d’ya think it’s a good thing?
He doesn’t think it’s that impressive, cause they look the same anyway.
They could've just put any sheep in there, and go: “Look, the same”. Yeah. Brilliant.
So, there was a program on people talking about--
What are you talking about "chicken with teeth"?
That's, it was the latest news, it was like all about the war and that, I was like, “yeah, yeah, yeah”. And there was a chicken with with teeth, and I said: “Hang on”-

Yeah, you didn’t hear anything about the war, did ya? That was, like, they might as well have been speaking French. Or just, like, whistles (Ricky whistles) “And now: A story about a chicken with teeth”.
Owh, God. Don't open the flood gates.
No, but I'm just saying I don't know the ‘full thing'.
Anyway, other stuff I did do proper research on in the week--
The same magazine that was doing the hanky coverage-
Letting you all know what all that's about.
How can we get him as a pundit on these news shows, like Newsnight, d'ya know what I mean? Sky, Sky News...
